byline.original: By MICHAEL COOPER and ALLISON KOPICKI

abstract: New York Times/CBS News poll finds that unemployed Americans are optimistic about finding a job despite enduring hardships and lingering pessimism about the economy; poll also finds that there is deep unease about unemployment benefits with most people who receive unemployment benefits reporting that the money is not enough to meet their basic needs.
snippet: A New York Times/CBS News poll found that despite enduring hardships and pessimism about the economy, unemployed Americans were optimistic about landing a job.
lead_paragraph: A New York Times/CBS News poll found that despite enduring hardships and pessimism about the economy, unemployed Americans were optimistic about landing a job.

headline.main: Facing Hardship, Jobless Still Say They Have Hope
headline.print_headline: Facing Hardship, Jobless Still Say They Have Hope
headline.seo: Jobless Go Without, but Stay Hopeful, Poll Finds
